intro: Dasycarya, commonly known as the rock lichen, is a genus of lichens that belongs to the family Verrucariaceae. These organisms are composite life forms consisting of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga or cyanobacterium. Dasycarya species are often found growing on rocky surfaces, especially in arid or semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their crust-like growth form and dark, often black or brown, colored thallus. Due to their ability to survive in harsh conditions, they play an important role in soil stabilization and ecological succession in rocky habitats.
